script.text: 对话：教室 (Classroom)

script.zh: 今天说爱好。你们平时喜欢做什么？矮中？
script.en: Today we're talking hobbies. What do you guys like to do? 矮中?

script.zh: 打篮球，出去玩，认识新朋友，到处逛。我是social型的人。
script.en: Basketball, going out, meeting new people, wandering around. I'm a social type of guy.

script.zh: 也是。没什么不好意思的。我每天都在外面体验生活。对了老师——"rizz"中文怎么说？
script.en: Also true. No shame in that. I'm out there experiencing life every day. Oh right, teacher — how do you say "rizz" in Chinese?

script.zh: Rizz。就是charm。跟女生说话很smooth的那种。
script.en: Rizz. Like charm. Being smooth when you talk to girls.

script.zh: 我不知道那是什么。中文可以说……有魅力？或者会撩人？
script.en: I don't know what that is. In Chinese you could say... having charm? Or knowing how to flirt?

script.zh: 等一下。撩是一个真的词？！中文真的有rizz这个概念？？
script.en: Hold on. 撩 is a real word?! Chinese actually has a concept for rizz??

script.zh: 中文什么词都有。这个语言有五千年历史。
script.en: Chinese has a word for everything. The language has five thousand years of history.

script.zh: ……我真的不知道这些词。我们能继续——
script.en: ...I really don't know these words. Can we move on —

script.zh: 我真的听不懂你在说什么。
script.en: I genuinely cannot understand what you're saying.

script.zh: 我们的中文老师连基本的slang都不会翻译。我们交钱是为了什么？
script.en: Our Chinese teacher can't even translate basic slang. What are we paying for?

script.zh: 其实，不骗你就是"no cap"。绝了差不多是"bussin"。
script.en: Actually, 不骗你 is basically "no cap." 绝了 is pretty much "bussin."

script.zh: 看书。设计。跑步。画画。我在台北的时候，每天早上沿着淡水河跑。那个风景——山、河、光——台湾的自然景色是全亚洲最美的，这个不接受反驳。而且你知道吗，台湾的设计圈——
script.en: Reading. Design. Running. Drawing. When I was in Taipei, I'd run along the Tamsui River every morning. The scenery — mountains, river, light — Taiwan's natural landscape is the most beautiful in all of Asia, and I won't hear otherwise. And you know what, Taiwan's design scene —

script.zh: 我的爱好在台湾发生的，所以——
script.en: My hobbies happened in Taiwan, so —

script.zh: 你有没有不在台湾的爱好？
script.en: Do you have any hobbies that aren't in Taiwan?

script.zh: 韩国音乐。护肤。化妆。拍照。我上个星期的屏幕使用时间是每天十一个小时。
script.en: K-pop. Skincare. Makeup. Taking photos. My screen time last week was eleven hours a day.
I know. I'm working on it.
Working on it how? Watching more K-pop?

script.zh: 弹钢琴。看书。学语言。我会说英文、中文、一点马来语，正在学日语。
script.en: Piano. Reading. Learning languages. I speak English, Chinese, a little Malay, and I'm learning Japanese.

script.zh: 你也太牛了吧。五种语言。
script.en: You're way too impressive. Five languages.

script.zh: 三种半。我的日语很基础。
script.en: Three and a half. My Japanese is super basic.
Look at my phone. Sleep. Order delivery.
...I used to draw when I was little. My mom taught me.

script.zh: 那很好。你应该重新开始画。
script.en: That's nice. You should start drawing again.

script.zh: 那老师也说说我的爱好吧——
script.en: Let me also share my hobbies —

script.text: Beat. 怪老师 blinks. Looks around the room. Nobody objects. He decides to answer anyway.
script.en: Beat. 怪老师 blinks. Looks around the room. Nobody objects. He decides to answer anyway.

script.text: He trails off, staring at the ceiling, genuinely thinking.
script.en: He trails off, staring at the ceiling, genuinely thinking.

script.zh: 那个……那个……那个问题很有意思。
script.en: Um... um... that's actually an interesting question.

script.text: The room is normal. Nobody reacts. Except —
script.en: The room is normal. Nobody reacts. Except —

script.text: 矮中文 slowly sits up straight. His eyes have changed.
script.en: 矮中文 slowly sits up straight. His eyes have changed.

script.zh: 我喜欢喝茶。那个……还有看书。那个……古典文学。
script.en: I like drinking tea. Um... and reading. Um... classical literature.
Um — right, I also like calligraphy.

script.sub: to the table, barely containing himself

script.text: He mouths it. 小黑 squints. Then shrugs and goes back to her phone. She does not care.
script.en: He mouths it. 小黑 squints. Then shrugs and goes back to her phone. She does not care.

script.text: 清清 has been very still for the past thirty seconds. She has her pen in her hand. She has not written anything.
script.en: 清清 has been very still for the past thirty seconds. She has her pen in her hand. She has not written anything.
清清, did you hear that?

script.text: 清清 looks up. Her expression is not what anyone expected. She is pressing her lips together very hard. Her ears are slightly pink.
script.en: 清清 looks up. Her expression is not what anyone expected. She is pressing her lips together very hard. Her ears are slightly pink.

script.text: She looks back down at her notebook. But the corner of her mouth has done something.
script.en: She looks back down at her notebook. But the corner of her mouth has done something.

script.sub: emboldened, turning back to the front

script.zh: 那个?就是……那个。"That." 语气词。你不知道吗?
script.en: Nàge? It just means... that. A filler word. You don't know that?

script.zh: 我知道！我只是……我只是觉得……那个那个那个那个那个——
script.en: I know! I just... I just think... nàge nàge nàge nàge nàge —

script.text: He is saying it like he won something. He kind of looks like he won something.
script.en: He is saying it like he won something. He kind of looks like he won something.

script.text: 矮中文 — sharp inhale.
王崩 — eyes closed, pained.

script.zh: Wassup那个，你怎样? 那个，我们去喝奶茶吗? 那个那个那个——
script.sub: standing up, to anyone who will listen
script.en: Wassup nàge, how you doing? Nàge, wanna go get boba? Nàge nàge nàge —

script.text: 清清 is the last one still seated. She is looking at the door he just left through. Her notebook is open. She has written nothing.
script.en: 清清 is the last one still seated. She is looking at the door he just left through. Her notebook is open. She has written nothing.

script.text: She closes it.
The corner of her mouth does the thing again.
script.en: The corner of her mouth does the thing again.

script.text: 1. 会 — can / know how to
2. 喜欢 + verb
3. 正在 + verb — in progress
4. 太...了 — too / so

script.en: 撩 (liáo) = The Chinese Art of Rizz

vocab.note: 中国年轻人天天点外卖
Most common Chinese filler word. Sounds like... yeah.
王崩 to 矮中文, daily

grammarNotes.title: 会 — can / know how to
grammarNotes.body:
我会说英文。= I can speak English.
我会弹钢琴。= I can play piano.
Note: 会 = learned ability. 能 = physical ability. 可以 = permission.

grammarNotes.title: 喜欢 + verb
grammarNotes.body:
我喜欢打篮球。
她喜欢看手机。
他喜欢提台湾。（小黑的看法）

grammarNotes.title: 正在 + verb — in progress
grammarNotes.body:
我正在学日语。= I'm currently learning Japanese.
她正在看手机。= She's currently on her phone.

grammarNotes.title: 太...了 — too / so
grammarNotes.body:
你也太牛了吧！= You're SO awesome!
那挺离谱的。= That's pretty ridiculous.
Note: 太...了 can be positive OR negative depending on context.

cultureNotes.title: 撩 (liáo) = The Chinese Art of Rizz
cultureNotes.body: 撩 literally means "to tease" or "to flirt." 会撩 means "knows how to flirt" = has rizz. 撩妹 = to flirt with girls. 撩汉 = to flirt with guys. This is REAL Chinese that real Chinese people use every day. Your textbook won't teach you this. 矮中很想学这个词。

cultureNotes.title: 外卖文化
cultureNotes.body: 中国的外卖系统是全世界最发达的。美团、饿了么——半小时内送到。中国年轻人点外卖的频率远超做饭。小李每天点外卖完全是正常的中国大学生行为。

cultureNotes.title: 那个 — The Filler Word That Breaks American Brains
cultureNotes.body:
那个 (nàge / nèige) is one of the most common filler words in Mandarin — the Chinese equivalent of "um" or "uh." Native speakers use it constantly mid-sentence while thinking. It is completely neutral, completely normal, and sounds almost exactly like a word that is absolutely not neutral or normal in English.

This is a known phenomenon. Chinese teachers in America deal with it. Chinese-American students have learned to brace for it. The phonetic overlap is real: 那个 is pronounced close enough to the n-word that untrained American ears stop functioning the moment they hear it in a lecture.

The important thing is: there is no workaround. Chinese speakers will not stop using it. It is not going anywhere. You will hear it constantly. You will need to make peace with this.

矮中文's reaction — gleeful, immediate, fully unhinged — is perhaps not the recommended approach. But it is an understandable one.
